findings.title: Immutable Declaration Improvement (IDI)
findings.description: The contract uses variables that initialize them only in the constructor, but these variables are not defined as `immutable`.

findings.title: State Variables could be Declared Constant (L02)
findings.description: Some state variables can be declared as constant using the `constant` keyword.

findings.title: Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions (L04)
findings.description: The code does not follow the Solidity style guide for naming conventions, making it less readable and maintainable.

findings.title: Unused State Variable (L05)
findings.description: There is an unused state variable in the contract that creates clutter and increases deployment cost.

findings.title: Uninitialized Variables in Local Scope (L14)
findings.description: Using uninitialized local variables can lead to unpredictable behavior and errors in the contract.

findings.title: Validate Variable Setters (L16)
findings.description: The contract performs operations on user-supplied input without proper checks, which can lead to problems when the value is zero.
